title.narrative: Republic of Congo - Investment Climate and Forest Governance Support Project (PACIGOF)
République du Congo - Projet d’Appui au Climat des Investissements et à la Gouvernance sectorielle - Foret/Bois (PACIGOF)

description.narrative: Le projet d’appui au climat des investissements et à la gouvernance sectorielle - Foret/Bois (PACIGOF) répond à la nécessité de diversifier l’économie congolaise par l’accroissement de la production nationale hors-pétrole. Ce projet répond également au besoin crucial de renforcer la compétition et les capacités des opérateurs privés à travers les programmes de promotion et de soutien aux petites et moyennes entreprises (PME) dans les secteurs prioritaires (artisanat, forêt et industrie du bois). Le PACIGOF contribuera à l’accroissement des recettes fiscales de l’Etat permettant, ainsi, à la République du Congo d’améliorer, de façon durable, les performances économiques et financières de l’Etat et des entreprises. Le coût total du projet, droits de douane et taxes compris, est estimé à 30,0 millions d’UC (soit environ 24,64 milliards de FCFA au taux de change en vigueur en mars 2015). Il s’articule autour de trois composantes : (i) l'appui aux PME et à la promotion de l’investissement ; (ii) l'appui à la gouvernance du secteur forêt/Bois ; et (iii) l'appui à la gestion du projet.

The Investment Climate and Forest Governance Support Project (PACIGOF) responses to the need to diversify the Congolese economy through higher national non-oil production. This project reponses also to strengthen competition and private operators’ capacity through programmes that promote and support small- and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) in priority sectors (handicrafts, forestry and timber industry). The PACIGOF will contribute to increasing State tax revenue, enabling the Republic of Congo to sustainably improve the economic and financial performance of the State and businesses. The project’s total cost, including customs duties and taxes, is estimated at UA 30 million (equivalent to about CFAF 24.64 billion, at the exchange rate effective as of March 2015). It has three components: (i) SME and investment promotion support; (ii) forest/timber sector governance support; and (iii) project management support.

Les principaux bénéficiaires du projet sont: (i) les populations en général et plus spécifiquement les institutions de soutien au secteur privé, les Ministères sectoriels et le secteur privé qui verront leurs capacités améliorées, leurs structures renforcées et leurs ressources augmentées; (ii) les organisations de la Société civile qui bénéficieront d’un renforcement de leur capacité dans la gestion durable des forêts, les associations féminines impliquées dans des activités économiques grâce à la mise en place du centre pour l’entrepreneuriat féminin.

The project’s main beneficiaries are: (i) the whole population and more specifically, private sector support institutions, sector ministries and the private sector whose capacity will be built and resources increased; (ii) civil society organizations that will benefit from capacity-building in sustainable forest management, and women’s associations involved in economic activities, thanks to the establishment of the women entrepreneurship centre.

L’objectif global du projet est de contribuer à une croissance forte et inclusive à travers l’amélioration du climat de l’investissement et la diversification de l’économie congolaise. Les objectifs spécifiques du projet sont : (i) renforcer les capacités des institutions de soutien au secteur privé et promouvoir l’initiative privé et (ii) améliorer la gouvernance du secteur forêt /Bois.

The project’s overall objective is to contribute to robust and inclusive growth by improving the business climate and diversifying the Congolese economy. Its specific objectives are to: (i) strengthen the capacity of private sector support institutions and promote private initiative; and (ii) improve forest/timber sector governance.

mailing-address.narrative: African Development Bank Group Headquarters Avenue Joseph Anoma 01 BP 1387 Abidjan 01, Côte d'Ivoire

receiver-org.narrative: GOUVERNEMENT DE LA REPUBLIQUE DU CONGO MINISTERE DU PLAN ET DES FINANCES ETAT-BAD-PARE

title.narrative: An action plan for the compulsory certification of concessions is operational

target.value: At least 3 million ha of concessions certified FSC at end-2018

title.narrative: Goods and services exports by the private sector (as a percentage of GDP)
Rating of the business Business Report environment in the Doing Business classification
Forest/timber sector tax revenue as a percentage of GDP
Rating of business creation in the Doing Business classification
National sensitization campaigns for the formalization and registration of informal sector workers

target.value: Approved Management Centre (AMC) arrangement is put in place and operational

actual.value: Few AMCs exist in Congo and are based mostly in Pointe-Noire

title.narrative: A strategy for the development of forest entrepreneurship aligned to MPMEA is effective through incubators and nurseries set up

target.value: A strategy is formulated in 2017, and incubators and assistance tools put in place at MEC no later than 2019

actual.value: Forest entrepreneurship is not effective and no specific support strategy exists to this day

title.narrative: Studies and implementation plan with corresponding budget for Corporate House (MEC) and Handicrafts Chamber (CMA)

actual.value: MEC and CMA are not functional

title.narrative: Renovation engineering studies are conducted and the related equipment procured

target.value: MEFDD premises are rehabilitated and equipped in 2018

actual.value: No engineering studies and equipment to be procured earmarked

title.narrative: A bill governing support for business creation in priority sectors by incubators is instituted

target.value: Incubators, nurseries and women entrepreneurship centre are created and operational in 2018

actual.value: No entrepreneurship support mechanisms in priority sectors

title.narrative: An operational diagnosis aimed at the organization and operating conditions of the sector is undertaken

target.value: The sector is organized into a cluster, and an inter-profession and sector committee is put in place latest end-2018

actual.value: No formal organization of the sector and no action plan adopted for that purpose

title.narrative: Ministerial decree instituting local content is prepared

target.value: Local content is effective and mandatory in the priority sectors of NDP

title.narrative: Existence of a specific support and training programme
An incubator and a nursery are created to support entrepreneurship in priority sector

target.value: Entrepreneurship in priority sectors is supervised by support mechanisms as from 2018

actual.value: No specific entrepreneurship support measures in the priority sectors

title.narrative: An action plan for the implementation of the staff training programme is effective

target.value: 215 MEFDD staff are trained and their capacity strengthened latest in 2018

title.narrative: A framework organizing demand and supply is formalized and functional

target.value: The sub-contracting exchange is functional latest 2018
